In Memory of George Bracamonte~

Dear Tanque Verde District Families,

It is with great sadness, we are writing to inform you that our beloved maintenance person, George Bracamonte, passed away unexpectedly on Monday, August 10th. George has been a valued member of the Tanque Verde community since he started working at Tanque Verde Elementary School in 1979. As a boy, he also attended Tanque Verde Elementary. George was steadfastly present at every school event and Fall Festival, ensuring those events went smoothly. His humor and good character were unfailing. George Bracamonte’s tireless dedication to the school and district was evident in his daily interactions with students, families, and staff. He will be greatly missed by all whose lives he touched. ~ Our deepest condolences to Mr. Bracamonte's family.

In lieu of flowers, the family is accepting donations to assist with funeral expenses.

Good News is worth repeating
Tanque Verde High School receives coronavirus grant -

Tanque Verde High School has been awarded an Expansion and Innovation Fund grant, designed to support students significantly disrupted by COVID-19.

The grants, awarded to 18 schools, were funded by an initial $1 million contribution from Gov. Doug Ducey’s Emergency Education Relief fund through the federal CARES Act to improve access to high-quality teaching and learning this school year.

The first round of awards are worth a total of $850,000.

A second-round grant cycle for district, magnet, charter and private schools is expected to open soon and will be supported by philanthropic and private contributions.

“A for Arizona’s Expansion and Innovation Fund supports school leaders and educators who find creative, effective ways to serve vulnerable students and work toward closing the achievement gap,” Ducey said in a statement.

TVUSD is now a Remind district!!
We are excited to share that Tanque Verde Unified School District is rolling out Remind district-wide! If you're not already familiar with Remind, it's a classroom communication tool that makes it easy to stay involved with your child's learning. Remind is free to use, and you'll be able to get and send messages on any device—even a simple text from your phone!

As part of this roll-out, we are asking PreK-12 parents to join by responding to the invitation from your student’s teacher(s). Secondary students received an email on August 6th, via their TVUSD student email account from Remind, with instructions about how to claim their account in coordination with the start of the school year.
We're excited to make connecting with our families more engaging as we Return to Learning for the 2020-21 School Year!

For more information: https://www.remind.com/

#TVUSDReturntoLearning! #TanqueVerdeSchools #Remind #CreatingOpportunitiesforSuccess

*Participate in one of these government subsidies programs: The National School Lunch Program, SNAP, TANF, Head Start, WIC, LIHEAP, or Public Housing.

We are so proud of TVHS Teacher, Mr. Jeremy Samoy! We are very pleased to highlight his accomplishment in our Good News Monday Series!!

Tanque Verde High School U.S. History and AP U.S. History Teacher, and Mock Trial Coach, Mr. Jeremy Samoy was one of four John J. Ross 2020 Award winners in the State of Arizona. The award, from the Arizona Foundation for Legal Services Education, annually recognizes exceptional contributions of Arizona educators in furthering understanding of the role of the law in our democratic society.

“I believe that students best learn history when they can relate it to their personal lives, and see the connection between the past and the present, stated Mr. Samoy. “ I feel that it is essential for students to be active participants in learning, and critically evaluate history.”

According to the John J. Ross Award nomination, submitted by Empire HS Teacher, Ms. Jennifer Roberts, Mr. Samoy is recognized for his efforts to promote the growth of the Mock Trial Program in Pima County.

Read the complete article here: http://ow.ly/t4fL50zbkEF

The Tanque Verde High School Mock Trial class, with teacher Jeremy Samoy, was fortunate to be able to take a field trip to the Evo A. Deconcini Federal Courthouse yesterday. The students received a tour of the building and watched several sentencing hearings. The U.S. Marshalls gave a presentation as well, and they allowed the students to handle their tools, from shields to battering rams. They even got to lock each other up in handcuffs. Judge Lynette Kimmins also let the class use her courtroom to practice for their upcoming competition, which was invaluable for the students. The students had support from one of their attorney coaches, Mr. Henry Jacobs, as they prepared. It's great to be a TVHS Hawk!

Congratulations to TVHS Student, Karah Mayer, for competing in the Optimist Club International Oratorical Contest in St. Louis on July 19th!

In order to reach that level of competition, first Karah competed against other TVHS students in Jeremy Samoy's Mock Trial class, where she was selected as one of the top 8 students. Then, she competed in the local HEAT Optimist Club contest, where she placed 2nd overall. Next, she vied with other students from around Tucson in the Zone contest where she placed 1st!

Karah was then invited to enter the state competition in April, where she placed 1st, earning her the right to participate in the International Competition. The St. Louis competition started with 27,000 students and Karah placed in the top 49!

Mr. Samoy shared the news with Tanque Verde staff members and encouraged everyone to congratulate Karah, “...really an awesome achievement for her!” This is the first time one of Mr. Samoy’s students has reached this level of competition.

Congratulations again to Karah!

shared_text:
Pima County Transportation
June 14, 2019 at 5:00 PM ·

Monsoon season 2019 officially starts tomorrow, June 15 and PCDOT is ready with all hands on deck.

Recently, staff participated in a Regional Storm Readiness Exercise with the Pima County Office of Emergency Management group along with other county departments, local agencies, the Tohono O’odham Nation and the Pascua Yaqui Tribe to make sure everyone is prepared. And barricades and equipment have been placed throughout the county in flood prone areas to ensure efforts are carried out successfully.

Please avoid areas subject to flooding and do not drive around barricades. Turn Around, Don’t Drown.

More flood safety info here: http://www.pima.gov/befloodsafe
